leb.text: After these things Jesus found him at the temple and said to him, “Look, you have become well! Sin no longer, lest something worse happen to you.”
The man went and reported to the Jews that Jesus was the one who made him well.
And on account of this the Jews began to persecute Jesus, because he was doing these things on the Sabbath.
But he answered them, “My Father is working until now, and I am working.”
So on account of this the Jews were seeking even more to kill him, because he not only was breaking the Sabbath, but also was calling God his own Father, thus making himself equal with God.

nirv.text: Later Jesus found him at the temple. Jesus said to him, “See, you are well again. Stop sinning, or something worse may happen to you.”
The man went away. He told the Jews it was Jesus who had made him well.
Jesus was doing these things on the Sabbath day. So the Jews began to oppose him.
Jesus said to them, “My Father is always doing his work. He is working right up to this very day. I am working too.”
For this reason the Jews tried even harder to kill him. Jesus was not only breaking the Sabbath. He was even calling God his own Father. He was making himself equal with God.
